title: Video2X Doesn't Recognise Many Valid MP4 Files as Videos

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

body:
## Component Versions
video2x-4.7.0-win32-full.zip

Please at least fill in the release version and GUI or CLI version.

- **Video2X release version**:   4.7.0 full
- **Upscaler version**:
- **GUI version**:
- **CLI version**:

## Symptom

Video2x exits the upscale process immediately after "start" is pressed in the GUI, with the following error showing in the command window:

[!] ERROR: File D:\{filename}.mp4 (inode/blockdevice) neither an image nor a video

The video in question is a valid .MP4 video file.  It was created using Adobe Media Encoder CC 2020 from a SD .AVI source video (originally captured from PAL DV tape).  

To test this as a bug, I created several different encodes from the original AVI file with both Adobe Media Encoder and also Handbrake.  None of the .MP4 files created with AME are recognised as 'videos' by Video2x, and only one of the .MP4 files created with Handbrake were recognised.  All the videos were compressed as h264/x264.

The output from MediaInfo for each file is as follows (only the last one was recognised by Video2X as a video):

**1) Original AVI file (not recognised as a video by Video2x):**
